title: Learning to Select the Relevant History Turns in Conversational Question Answering. (arXiv:2308.02294v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: The increasing demand for the web-based digital assistants has given a rapid rise in the interest of the Information Retrieval (IR) community towards the field of conversational question answering (ConvQA). However, one of the critical aspects of ConvQA is the effective selection of conversational history turns to answer the question at hand. The dependency between relevant history selection and correct answer prediction is an intriguing but under-explored area. The selected relevant context can better guide the system so as to where exactly in the passage to look for an answer. translated_title: 学习选择会话问答中相关的历史对话转折点
translated_abstract: 对于基于网络的数字助手的日益需求，引起了信息检索(IR)社区对会话式问答(ConvQA)领域的兴趣。然而，ConvQA的一个关键方面是有效选择会话历史转折点以回答当前问题。相关历史选择与正确答案预测之间的依赖关系是一个有趣但未被充分探索的领域。选择的相关上下文可以更好地指导系统在文章中寻找答案的确切位置。而不相关的上下文则给系统带来噪音，从而导致模型性能下降。本文提出了一个框架DHS-ConvQA（会话问答中的动态历史选择），首先为所有历史转折点生成上下文和问题实体，然后根据它们与问题的相似度进行修剪。
tldr: 这篇论文提出了一个名为DHS-ConvQA的框架，用于在会话式问答中动态选择相关的历史转折点，以指导答案的准确预测。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a framework called DHS-ConvQA for dynamically selecting relevant history turns in conversational question answering to guide accurate answer prediction.
